DOC.brief_summary: This study is to evaluate the efficacy of ultraviolet-A (UVA) and riboflavin application (also often referred to as corneal collagen crosslinking) as a method to enhance treatment of infectious keratitis.
DOC.brief_title: Ultraviolet-A and Riboflavin Treatment for Infectious Keratitis
DOC.criteria: 1. Subjects must be 18 years of age or older. 2. Ability to provide written informed consent. 3. Likely to complete all study visits. 4. Subjects must have one eye that with a diagnosis of infectious keratitis. 1. A corneal perforation. 2. Descemetocele. 3. Pregnancy or breastfeeding. 4. Active Herpes corneal disease. 5. Patient is unwilling or unable to comply with a medication regimen and follow up appointments.
